Reviews.Content: Perfect Stayed at the Catalonia Moratin for 4 nights in July. The hotel is in a perfect location, 5 mins from nearest metro and just around the corner from Plaza Santa Ana, Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor.Hotel very modern  clean, staff friendly  efficent. Air conditioned room very welcome after Madrid heat. Excellent value, would recommend.
Reviews.Author: UkFlyaway

Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, even better location! Got cheap Easyjet flights and booked this reasonably priced 4* hotel via Expedia - all went very well. The hotel was excellent quality, breakfast was superb and location was a short walk to almost anywhere. Lots of good bars, restaurants and shops nearby as well. Buy a metrobus pass if you need one. Used metro rather than go to the expense of transfers and it was unbelievably easy! All in all a good trip - can't wait to go again.
Reviews.Author: AngelaHi

Reviews.Content: Despite booking in advance sent to another hotel can't review because despite booking in advance, on arrival apparently some rooms were closed and we redirected to another hotel in chain - they were apologetic and paid for taxi and the other hotel was fine.....but disappointing that a booking didn't appear to guarantee a room!
Reviews.Author: SEC67

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel Great Location This is a nice hotel - very easy to get to by the underground. It was very quite considering it faces out on to a busy street. The staff were very pleasent and courteous. Breakfast was very good although the dining room is a bit cramped. It is a perfect location from which to visit all the major sites. One word of warning - nothing to do with the hotel. If you are travelling by underground from the airport, hold onto to you valuables very tightly. Our two lady companions both lost their purses to pickpockets. These people are very skilful and seem to specifically target new arrivals coming from the airport. Other wiise the city itself feels very safe and friendly.
Reviews.Author: LesSharpe

Reviews.Content: We booked but never got a room there!!! We booked a room from two months in advance and when we showed up, because of complete mismanagement, we were sent to another hotel, which was a good hotel to be honest. But then we left for Barcelona and on the second leg of our trip back in Mardid, again they refused to give us a room and sent us to another hote although we had booked more than two months before that!!!!, and this time we were sent to a worse hotel. We expected to receive good service by booking so far in advance, and yet we received anything but....
Reviews.Author: Sherix

Reviews.Content: An alright hotel We stayed in this hotel for three nights.It is very easy to get to from the airport and Madrid's metro is very cheap and relatively easy to use. The hotel is very central being round the corner from Puerta del Sol. On first seeing the hotel it appeared rather shabby from the outside.On arrival at the reception we were told that they didn't have a double room for us but only a twin room, but this was not a problem.However, despite the fact that I spoke to the receptionist in Spanish, he continued to reply in English ( perhaps my Spanish is that bad!),I regard this to be bad manners.Our room overlooked the courtyard but was nice enough with a small minibar. The breakfast was very good with lots of choice and the staff were friendly enough.On a few occasions, our keycard did not work.The hotel was fine but the receptionist staff were not the most friendly. I would probably return to this hotel if the price was right because it is central, however,I would be concerned by the recent report of the robberies from the rooms.
Reviews.Author: M1NX

Reviews.Content: Don't stay there! This hotel is a joke! Whilst we stayed there, on our second day, myself and my girlfriend room and four other rooms got robbed! Yes, someone entered the hotel through the reception, in the night, without anyone seeing him/her and opened the doors to the rooms without getting traced by the card key machine. We then realized, the next morning, the hotel had CCTV security in the reception area. But no, the tape only has 3 hours recording and the tape could not show who the thief was. The hotel did not give us any compensation to the money that got stolen as they claim we didn't put it in their safe (which we had to pay for)! Which 4-star hotel makes you pay for using their safe? Whatever makes you think that you want to stay here, don't, just don't!
Reviews.Author: mrintelligent0009

Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean and safe This was our first visit ( 57 year old and 63 year old). Our son found the hotel as a special deal and we stayed 4 nights. It is really easy to get to using the metro from the airport. We arrived very late on Sat. in May. but found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. At 11.30 pm we were at the Plaza Santa Anna having tappas and Sangria- recommended by the hotel.Brekfast the next morning was a help yourself buffet and the platters were never empty. You have a choice from eggs, sasuages, bacon, ham, cheese , pasteries and delicious cakes, fruit, cereals etc. Eat as much or as little as you want to set you up for the day.We walked to all the attractions and took the Madrid tourist bus on the last day to get an overall view of the city - recommended by the hotel staff.We rate the hotel more as a three star but it is well worth the money because of it's very convenient location.We would certainly use it again. Our room was small, but clean and fresh. We would recommend the use of the hotel safe! It's well worth the 3 euros a day for peace of mind.
Reviews.Author: travellerrani

Reviews.Content: good choice Just back from 3 nights at the Catalonia Moratin  would happily recommend it to others.We paid 102 per night with breakfast included. The room was big, it was simpy decorated, and everything in it seemed new and clean. The bathroom was spotless. The only thing missing was an iron.The best thing though is the location - All the main sights and museums are accessible on foot during the day. Also, the hotel is right beside the Plaza Santa Ana / Huertas area, which is one of the best places to be for food and drink.
Reviews.Author: iandel

Reviews.Content: Two rooms (sort of) for the price of one!! We (2 parents and a 9 year old) stayed in the Catalonia Moratin for 3 nights in May 2006. Our room was spacious, with a large and well-appointed bathroom. But the big bonus was that the room was actually TWO rooms. Although we'd booked on the basis of a double with an extra bed, there was a separate small room with a single bed. Our son was delighted to have his own hotel room, and it meant that we had more space and privacy. Staff were efficient and friendly, and the hotel is in a very convenient location for the sights and the Metro. We've recommended the Catalonia Moratin to friends, and we'd definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: Ulysses1874

Reviews.Content: Not the Ritz, but not bad at all Certainly not a four-star hotel, but a very decent place for exploring Madrid city center. Rooms are roomy and clean (even by U.S. standards) with a good bathroom featuring full tub/shower and a bidet. A room facing the street isn't particularly noisy, with double-pane glass on two sets of doors leading to a balcony that's literally more for window-dressing than actual use.Service is OK, although the check-in featured one of those our system is not working and we can't find your reservation situations. The staff took a copy of my itineary from the Website where I booked the room (and prepaid it), let me have the room, and finally sorted it out two days later. (This happened to several travelers at the Catalonia Moratin.)The breakfast self-serve was certainly fine and worth the extra fee (if you need to pay it) if you're used to a decent breakfast. The alternative is coffee or chocolate and churros at a local bar. The hotel breakfast features hot and cold food, including pastries, fruit, several types of meat and nicely fried eggs.The neighborhood can be off-putting; Calle de Atocha is a rough-hewn street that's not dangerous, but it's not the Gran Via or a leafy boulevard, either. (It's also not as light and bright as the promotional shot of the hotel would lead you to believe.) It's an area in transition with plenty of construction and renovation going on; it's also only a five-minute walk to a large area of tapas bars and restaurants, with menus (if not service) in English. The closest Metro stop is five minutes away, and it's less than ten minutes to walk to Sol or the Plaza Mayor.It's not the Palace, but it's a real step up from the budget hotels and very comfortable.
Reviews.Author: PS_Emerson

Reviews.Content: Great location Great location for seeing all the sites on foot. Staff are friendly and the buffet breakfast was fantastic to fill up on before site seeing!The room was clean and very comfortable, however we did ask for a non-smoking room and unfortunately we opened the door to the stale smell of cigarette ash and there were ash trays around the room (but I guess this is Europe). The only other issue we had is that the rooms have small balconies that open out internally to look down over the entrance, causing the smallest whisper to ecco up through the rooms making it impossible to sleep in or to have a siesta in the afternoon.
Reviews.Author: sellybelly

Reviews.Content: Great Location This hotel is in the heart of Madrid with easy access to the Prado, Plaza Major and many shopping venues. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside but inside it is clean, friendly and the rooms for our first two nights were huge! We stayed again later in the month and the rooms were not quite as big but very adequate and up to date. Would definitely stay there again in future.P.J. Calgary Canada
Reviews.Author: Biggyb

Reviews.Content: Good central hotel Stayed here for three nights, good central location close to Santa Anna Square, famous for Tapas. Good modern clean rooms.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: No Four-Star Here, Folks This is not really the 4-star hotel it proclaims itself to be. Despite its unsual decor -- half old, half ultra-modern, it has a very mediocre dining room (tiny, too), and weird rooms that open either to the street or to the noisy lobby area below. We also had a broken toilet the whole time we stayed -- the best we got the staff to do was spray our room, which smelled of sewage: they never fixed the toilet. Great shower, though, and the beds were nice, plus it was clearn. A solid-three-star -- and it is in a great location.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Catalonia Moratin Madrid Stayed here for a family visit . First impression not very good-- but once inside the doorway- it's very impressive! Old world building- modernised.  Our bedroom was very comfortable, large comfortable bed. nice bathroom where everything worked . Staff were very polite and helpful and most spoke good English .  We only ate in hotel at breakfast of which there was a variety of dishes catering for several different nationalities amongst them a party from Chicago.
